clues.text: "M" is for this man who died just 5 years after his son passed away at age 777
"P" es for these people whom Jesus calls "hypocrites" & "ye generation of vipers"
"J" is for this man, who says, "My brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man"
"E" is for this city in "witch" King Saul gets very bad news
"C" is for this high priest who presided over Jesus' first trial
In 1982 this future German chancellor got a divorce after 5 years of marriage but kept the last name
Divorce & remarriage to a divorcee named Happy helped kill a 1964 presidential bid by this rich GOP moderate
Their storybook royal romance produced 2 daughters but ended in 1996
Andrew Jackson loved her so much he married her twice; her divorce from an Army officer wasn't final the first time
Around 1880 this Irish Nationalist leader said, hello, Kitty O'Shea, leading to her divorce & his political ruin
This seat, the title of a Thurber story, is a position of great advantage
It's the point in the orbit of a planet at which it's nearest to the sun
This French phrase refers to a form of psychosis in which 2 people share the same delusions
This 3-letfer Hindi word is used in India as a title of respect for a man
Often seen in crosswords, this 4-letter word for a small decorative case to hold needles is from the Old French

rounds.comments: (Alex: You have to identify the stream. Actually, you have to identify the river.)

clues.text:
In North America:
Goat Island &
Navy Island

In the Midwest:
Blanchard Island &
Kaskaskia Island (until the silt came)

On continental Europe:
Obuda Island

Off continental Europe:
Temple Mill Island &
Eel Pie Island

Elephantine Island &
Kitchener's Island

The act Bill signed in his first month in office granting workers time off
clues.response: the Family and Medical Leave Act

clues.text: 2013 brought the very rare coincidence of Thanksgiving & this religious holiday

March 2 is a holiday in this state, celebrating its 1836 independence
There's a day of the week in this word, a synonym for Pentecost
It's believed that Imhotep helped create this calendar in which new year is usually September 11
Hyphenated term for any sycophant or toady
2-word nickname of 19th century Arkansas arbiter Isaac Parker, who favored capital punishment
As we all learned in 2000, these dangle off incompletely punched paper ballots
Ray Guy's punts inspired the NFL to create a statistic for this
Slang for one who passes bad checks
On "(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction"
In Gershwin's "Rhapsody In Blue"

On "Be My Baby" by The Ronettes

clues.text: On July 29, 1981 Johnny said these 2 had "a fairy-tale romance. Too bad they had to spoil it & get married"
Can we talk? No! After this "Tonight Show" fixture got her own gig on Fox in 1986, Johnny never spoke to her again
Johnny's "Tonight Show" debuted on Oct. 1, 1962; guests included Groucho & this "Mildred Pierce" actress
On Carson in 1982 he said, "I'm from a predominantly black family, & I have yet to run into a relative named Buckwheat"
In his last monologue, Johnny said this huge corp. "named me employee of the month...that was a dream come true"
Doc Brown created the flux capacitor, which is what makes time travel possible, in this film
Dr. Ryan Stone is a medical engineer on her first shuttle mission in this 2013 film
An un-Gandhi-like Ben Kingsley takes a child chess prodigy under his wing in this 1993 film
Hugh Jackman is super-hacker Stanley Jobson in this 2001 film; give us the password
Coal miner's son Homer Hickam (Jake Gyllenhaal) takes up rocketry in this film

clues.response: there's a chicken in every pot
